title:
<Research Report>CLSA: Reported CN Ban of Intel/AMD Chips in Govt PCs is 
Old News, No Negative Impact for ...
text: Lyon reports that LENOVO GROUP (00992.HK)  -0.030 (-0.330%)    Short selling $86.40M; Ratio 24.062%    shares crashed 8.6% yesterday (25 Mar), perhaps due to market concerns that the Chinese government won't use PCs or servers powered by Advanced Micro Devices (AMD.US)       and Intel (INTC.US)      .The broker believed the policy was not new and would not have a negative impact on LENOVO, which has a 44% market share of non-x86 and non-Apple Mac systems in China. The government business only accounts for 5% to 6% of LENOVO's PC deliveries in China.Related NewsCiti: Reported CN Ban of Intel/AMD Chips in Govt PCs Has Limited Effect on LENOVO GROUP (00992.HK)The broker maintained its Buy rating on LENOVO and a price target of $9.6.(HK stocks quote is delayed for at least 15 mins.Short Selling Data as at 2024-03-28 16:25.) (Real-time Streaming US Stocks Quote; Except All OTC quotes are at least 15 minutes delayed.)AAStocks Financial News
